options.content:
# **üöÄ kube-burner-ocp virt density UDN benchmark dashboard**

This dashboard provides deep insights into the results of the virt-udn-density benchmark execution using kube-burner-ocp. For a deep dive into workload parameters and metric definitions, refer to the [official kube-burner-ocp documentation](https://kube-burner.github.io/kube-burner-ocp/latest/#virt-density-udn).

### ‚öôÔ∏è How to configure your view

Use the dropdown selectors at the top of the dashboard to filter the results:

- **Run UUID üîΩ:** Select the unique identifier for your benchmark execution to filter all visualizations for that specific test run.
- **Latency Percentile üìä:** Toggle between median (50th) for typical performance or tail latencies (90th/95th/99th) to identify worst-case bottlenecks in your infrastructure.

üìå **NOTE:**
- All latency metrics in this dashboard are reported in seconds.
- Since the OS image is pulled directly into the `virt-launcher` pod‚Äôs local directory (typically on the node‚Äôs root disk), no DataVolumes or PVCs are created or bound for this scenario.

targets.query: metricName.keyword:"jobSummary" AND jobConfig.name.keyword: create-udn*  AND uuid:"$uuid"
jobName.keyword:"virt-density-udn" AND metricName.keyword:"vmiLatencyMeasurement" AND NOT vmName.keyword:virt-client* AND uuid:"$uuid"
jobName.keyword:"virt-density-udn" AND metricName.keyword:"vmiLatencyMeasurement" AND vmName.keyword:virt-client* AND uuid:"$uuid"
jobName.keyword:"virt-density-udn" AND metricName.keyword:"vmiLatencyMeasurement" AND NOT vmName.keyword:virt-client* AND uuid:"$uuid"
jobName.keyword:"virt-density-udn" AND metricName.keyword:"vmiLatencyMeasurement" AND vmName.keyword:virt-client* AND uuid:"$uuid"

panels.description: Tracks the duration from VM creation to the Ready state, segmented by iteration to identify performance degradation as cluster density increases.
panels.title: VM ready latency per iteration

panels.description: Displays the distribution of VMs across physical nodes to track workload density and cluster balance.
panels.title: Distribution of VMs per host

panels.description: Displays the distribution of VMs across physical nodes to track workload density and cluster balance.
panels.title: VM ready latency per host (Average)

list.description: Filters the dashboard to show performance metrics for the selected virt-udn-density benchmark run ID
list.label: Run UUID
list.name: uuid

list.description: Selects the P-value (50th to 99th) for VM and DV latency calculations
list.label: Latency Percentile
list.name: percentile
